How much time do you spend using your smartphone in a day? More than 3 and a half hours More than 2 and a half hours and less than 3 and a half hours More than 1 hour and a half less than 2 and a half hours More than 30 minutes - less than 1 hour and 30 minutes less than 30 minutes Even when you\'re with family and friends, you often only look at your smartphone.\u000D\n STRONGLY AGREE AGREE NEUTRAL DISAGREE STRONGLY DISAGREE It\'s easier to talk on your smartphone than to talk in person.\u000D\n You\'ve had a bitter argument with the people around you over your smartphone.\u000D\n You\'ve had problems with your health or your daily life because of your smartphone. If your smartphone isn\'t around, you\'re anxious You\'ve seen your smartphone right before you fall asleep.\u000D\n Take your smartphone with you when you go to the bathroom.\u000D\n You look at your smartphone when you eat.\u000D\n You\'ve tried to reduce your smartphone usage time. Very good! GAME DESCRIPTION Explanation How to play DIGITAL MEMORY NUMS FOR DUMBS
Phones remember who we are, at the point that we do not know who knows more about who (you do not know a lot about your phone); but here we have one solution: MEMORY!. Is the brain skill that lets you remember (who you are, what you like, what you know), and this solution is a minigame that tries to help you improve that skill. You just have to touch the cards on the view and memorize the images inside them, and finally, touch more cards until you find the last card you memorized. GET FUN WHILE YOU TRAIN THIS AMAZING SKILL!
A total of 6 questions consisted of various information about smartphone addiction. (Smartphone addiction syndrome, prevention methods, etc.) The villagers have turned into zombies! Take the quiz to turn the townspeople back into humans! Read the question and press T if the question is correct. If the question is wrong, press F. There are a total of 6 questions. Repeat the above steps to solve all 6 issues. Press the T or F button to go directly to the next question. You cannot go back to a problem you have passed, so think carefully before clicking. The quiz questions used the contents of the About Smartphone Addiction category.
Excessive use of smartphones can lead to diseases such as pseudo-developmental disorders, game addiction, ADHD, and tic disorders. The brains of people who are addicted to smartphones are not very different from those of people who are not addicted to smartphones. Looking at the phone screen for a long time naturally increases the number of blinks, which can lead to dry eye syndrome. A digital genius is a phenomenon in which modern people are too dependent on smartphones, and various emergency and memory abilities decline, showing severe brain function deterioration. The more unnecessary applications you have on your smartphone, the less time you spend using your smartphone unnecessarily.\u000D\n Nomophobia Syndrome is an abbreviation for \u00E2\u0080\u0098No mobile phone phobia\u00E2\u0080\u0099 and refers to a syndrome in which people feel phobias without a smartphone.
//YoungerMen
Smartphone addiction refers to the act of not using a smartphone at all. Some seriously ill people with digital dementia cannot memorize their family\'s phone numbers, nor can they find their way without navigation. If you spend a lot of time on your smartphone, focusing on a small screen for a long time can easily cause strain on your eyes, which can be a direct cause of tendinosis of the eye or decreased vision. If you look at your smartphone a lot, it is visually exposed until you fall asleep, so an afterimage remains in your head, making it difficult to fall asleep. If you try to make a habit of not using your smartphone outside of set times, you will not use your smartphone outside of the time you use your smartphone, which will help prevent smartphone addiction. If you try to satisfy your heart through a method other than a smartphone and change your reckless smartphone use pattern to something else, it will not help you to solve your smartphone addiction.
//OldMen
Turning off unnecessary alarms helps prevent smartphone addiction. Being addicted to smartphones is far from healthy rewards. Blue light emitted from smartphones inhibits the secretion of the sleep-inducing hormone, melatonin, in our body, preventing healthy sleep. If children play the game repeatedly for a long time, only the occipital lobe develops and the frontal lobe falls, so thinking and judgment may be impaired. If you walk while looking at your smartphone, your attention is drawn to your smartphone, increasing the risk of a traffic accident or colliding with other pedestrians. FOMO syndrome refers to a fear of missing out on or being left out of one\'s own flow.
//RespuestasDuras

About Smartphone Addiction addiction phase You use your smartphone moderately, so it\'s still normal. Do not lose the current habit and keep it steady. Good
Normal There is a point that it can be dangerous because you use a smartphone a little bit. Constant management is necessary so as not to fall into smartphone addiction.
Dangerous Smartphone addiction symptoms may appear. When using a smartphone, the ability to control it is very poor, and you should try to use the smartphone systematically.
Very serious You are spending a lot of time in your daily life with a serious dependence on your smartphone. Excessive smartphone use can cause many problems. If you are experiencing a lot of problems, seek professional help.
problem Smartphone severe disease outbreak Due to excessive use of smartphones, the brain develops disproportionately, which can lead to social deficits such as pseudo-developmental disorders, game addiction, ADHD, tic disorder.
Similar brains in drug addicts If you look at the brain of a person who is addicted to a smartphone, it looks similar to that of a drug addict. If you require an immediate response, such as a game, the frontal lobe doesn\'t give you a chance to develop because the occipital lobe processes it right away. If children play games repeatedly for a long time, only the occipital lobe develops and the frontal lobe declines, so thinking and judgment may be impaired.
Away from healthy rewards The fact that you can easily get pleasure without putting much effort into it is similar to gambling on a slot machine. Once you get used to these things, you get a healthy sense of achievement or pleasure with some effort. There are side effects that keep you away from the reward process.
disruption of daily life You get tired of anything in the middle, but there are infinite contents such as smartphone games, webtoons, SNS, YouTube shopping, etc. It is difficult to stop because you can do something like this constantly.
poor communication Due to the smartphone, there are many cases of using a smartphone without having a conversation even when meeting. Nowadays, there are few people who do not use smartphones, but if they do not use them, they may fall into the information-oriented marginalized class and the conflict between generations may intensify.
turtle neck syndrome If you use your smartphone for a long time in the wrong posture, you are more likely to suffer from suffocating syndrome. Because the cell phone is often positioned below eye level, the eyes naturally turn downward, the cervical spine is damaged, and the pressure load on the neck becomes very high. If the posture of pulling the neck forward or bending the neck becomes a habit, the center of gravity moves forward, and later the ligaments of the neck and shoulder are stretched, resulting in turtle neck syndrome.
eye health Concentrating on a small screen for a long time can cause strain on the eyes, which can lead to tendinosis of the eye or decreased vision. If you look at the phone screen for a long time, the number of times you blink naturally decreases, which can lead to dry eye syndrome. In addition, the use of electronic devices for a long period of time puts strain on the eyes and may cause vision loss, especially when using a smartphone in a dark environment.
carpal tunnel syndrome If you use your fingers to operate a mobile phone, the muscles in your hand tend to become stiff. This can cause an abnormality in the median nerve of the hand, which can lead to carpal tunnel syndrome. Along with wrist pain, numbness around the thumb, index, and middle palms is severe, and when the symptoms worsen, the strength of the hand weakens and movement paralysis that prevents the use of the wrist may occur.
If you use your fingers to operate a mobile phone, the muscles in your hand tend to become stiff. This can cause an abnormality in the median nerve of the hand, which can lead to carpal tunnel syndrome. Along with wrist pain, numbness around the thumb, index, and middle palms is severe, and when the symptoms worsen, the strength of the hand weakens and movement paralysis that prevents the use of the wrist may occur. sleep disturbance
Blue light emitted from smartphones inhibits the secretion of a sleep-inducing hormone called melatonin in our body, preventing healthy sleep. In addition, it is recommended not to look at the smartphone before going to sleep, as it is visually splendidly exposed before going to sleep, so an afterimage remains in the head and it is difficult to fall asleep easily.
Popcorn Brain Popcorn Brain, when we use various electronic devices, our brain does not respond to the slow and less stimulating situations in reality, but only to the stimulating and powerful situations of the digital and online worlds, like popcorn popping. You may become lethargic and numb, making it difficult to carry out your normal daily life, experiencing depression, and leading to more severe smartphone addiction.
Solutions
1.Set smartphone usage time If you try to make a habit of not using your smartphone outside of set times, you will not use your smartphone outside of the time you use your smartphone, which will help prevent smartphone addiction.
2. Delete unnecessary applications As the number of unnecessary applications on the smartphone increases, the amount of time spent using the smartphone unnecessarily increases. If you leave only necessary applications and delete unnecessary applications, unnecessary smartphone usage time can also disappear, thereby preventing smartphone addiction.
3. Don\'t use your smartphone on the street\n It is a good idea to keep your smartphone in your pocket when walking on the street. This is because if you walk while looking at your smartphone, your attention is drawn to your smartphone, which increases the risk of a traffic accident or colliding with other pedestrians.
4. Recognize the cause of habitual use and find other solutions It is to find the cause of habitual smartphone use and try a new healthy way to solve the cause. If you try to satisfy your heart through a method other than a smartphone, and change your reckless smartphone use pattern to something else, it will help solve your smartphone addiction.
simple precautions
1. Turn off unnecessary alarms\n 2. Measure smartphone usage time consistently\n 3. Keep your smartphone out of sight\n 4. Find various hobbies\n 5. Do not use your smartphone before going to bed\n 6. Replacing smartphone usage time with time to give the brain a break, such as reading a book, exercising, or meditating
various syndromes
Nomophobia Syndrome No mobile phone phobia is an abbreviation for phobia, which means phobia. It has the meaning of feeling phobias without a phone.
FOMO Syndrome Abbreviation for Fear of missing out. It means fear of missing out. Feeling afraid of missing the flow or alienating yourself from it.
JOMO Syndrome An abbreviation of Joy of missing out, as opposed to Fomo Syndrome, meaning to rather enjoy being left out.
digital isolation syndrome A symptom of being isolated from the real world, feeling that it is more comfortable to communicate through a smartphone than to meet in person because I often communicate with people on smartphones. When it gets worse, it becomes difficult to communicate with others and have a social life.
ghost vibration syndrome The feeling that the phone vibrates when it is not actually vibrating. The stronger the anxiety in interpersonal relationships, the more severe the symptoms. It is caused by a sense of duty or anxiety to hold the smartphone in hand for fear of being rejected by others.
